intro: Oldenlandia tenuissima, commonly known as the slender leaf mistflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are often white or pale pink, and its slender, creeping stems that can form dense mats. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. The leaves are narrow and opposite, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface depending on the species.
